byline.original: By JESS BIDGOOD and SHERYL GAY STOLBERG

abstract: Legal experts say acquittal of Baltimore police officer Caesar R Goodson Jr on murder and other charges in death of Freddie Gray is huge blow to prosecution, and raises doubts over whether state should proceed with trials of four other officers; there are no convictions after three trials, and many say state's attorney Marilyn Mosby must rethink her strategy.
lead_paragraph: Officer Caesar R. Goodson Jr., who drove the van used to transport Mr. Gray, had faced seven charges, including second-degree murder.

headline.main: Acquittal in Freddie Gray Case Casts Doubts About Future Trials
headline.print_headline: Another Acquittal in Gray Case Casts Doubts About Future Trials

snippet: Officer Caesar R. Goodson Jr., who drove the van used to transport Mr. Gray, had faced seven charges, including second-degree murder.
